game

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameObject
      • game.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends GameObject
    This class extends the GameObject class; It is used to create a GameObject that players can create at will that will fly through the air, in an attempt to damage their opponents.
    Author:
    Clayton Nida

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(int x,
                  int y,
                  int id,
                  int facing,
                  Handler handler)
        This will construct the projectile at the given location and in the given direction. It will load the correct image based on the ID passed to it. It will begin flying 20 pixels a frame.
        Parameters:
        x - Starting x value of the projectile.
        y - Starting y value of the projectile.
        id - The ID number used to distinguish this GameObject from others.
        facing - The direction the projectile is facing.
        handler - The handler used to loop through all GameObjects.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        This is the method that will be called to "tick" the object. Each object will have different logic that will be used after tick is called.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        This will be used to draw the images needed. Depending on each GameObject, different things will be rendered. Example: players will have their models rendered, and level will have maps and platforms rendered.
        Specified by:
        render in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        g - The given Graphics object that will be used to draw/render all images.

      • doThrownCollisionDetection

        public void doThrownCollisionDetection(java.awt.Rectangle shot)
        This will loop through all GameObjects and check to see if the projectile collides with any players. If it does it removes itself and damages the player.
        Parameters:
        shot - The rectangle being checked for collision.
